intro: Ludia myrtoides, commonly known as the sweet myrtle, is a small evergreen shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces small, round, red berries that are edible and have a sweet, aromatic flavor. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers a sunny to partially shaded location. Ludia myrtoides is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
